term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - collision efficiency, B_c
term.title: collision efficiency

item.text: The collision efficiency, or de-energization efficiency, is defined by: k-1 = Bc.k-1scis the rate constant for a particular substance M when it brings about the de-energization process [image: Not defined] and k-1sc is the corresponding rate constant for a reference molecule M r that de-energizes A* on every collision; that is, the reference molecule M r undergoes strong collisions, and by definition has a collision efficiency Bc of unity. The species A* is usually in a vibrationally-excited state, and A has energy less than that required for reaction to occur.

item.meaning: De-energizing rate constant for reference molecule (in collision efficiency)
